title._content: ["Brookside," William Hall Walker house, Brookside Road, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Brookside," William Hall Walker house, Brookside Road, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. Perennial Garden pergola steps] [ca. 1916] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Carrère & Hastings, 1910 with 1912 alterations and additions for William Hall Walker. Landscape: Garden casino and garden by Ferruccio Vitale, 1912-1918. Associated Name: Carrie Jones (Mrs. William H.) Walker. Today: House and remaining grounds now Eisner camp for children sponsored by the Reform Movement in Judaism. On slide (handwritten): "W" and "Walker, W.H., Great Barrington, Mass." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Landscape pavilions--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Flowers--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16289 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 80
